intro: Regnellidium, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, often hairy stems and small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers. The leaves are typically alternate, lanceolate, and have a rough texture. Regnellidium species are native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. These plants are adapted to thrive in dry conditions and are often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
